verses.verse: "If a man<WH376> steals<WH1589> an ox<WH7794> or a sheep,<WH7716> and kills<WH2873> it,<WH4376> or sells it;<WH7999> he shall pay five<WH2568> oxen<WH1241> for an ox,<WH7794> and four<WH702> sheep<WH6629> for a sheep.<WH6629>
If the thief<WH1590> is found<WH4672> breaking in,<WH4290> and is struck<WH5221> so that he dies,<WH4191> there shall be no guilt of bloodshed for him.<WH1818>

If the sun<WH8121> has risen<WH2224> on him,<WH1818> guilt of bloodshed shall be for him;<WH7999> he shall make restitution.<WH7999> If he has nothing,<WH4376> then he shall be sold for his theft.<WH1591>
If the stolen property<WH1591> is<WH4672> found<WH4672> in his hand<WH3027> alive,<WH2416> whether it is ox,<WH7794> donkey,<WH2543> or sheep,<WH7716> he shall pay<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

"If a man<WH376> causes a field<WH7704> or vineyard<WH3754> to be eaten,<WH1197> and lets<WH7971> his animal<WH1165> loose,<WH1197> and it grazes in another man<WH312>'s field,<WH7704> he shall make restitution<WH7999> from the best<WH4315> of his own field,<WH7704> and from the best<WH4315> of his own vineyard.<WH3754>

"If fire<WH784> breaks out,<WH3318> and catches<WH4672> in thorns<WH6975> so that the shocks of grain,<WH1430> or the standing grain,<WH1430> or the field<WH7704> are consumed;<WH398> he who kindled<WH1197> the fire<WH1200> shall surely<WH7999> make restitution.<WH7999>

"If a man<WH376> delivers<WH5414> to his neighbor<WH7453> money<WH3701> or stuff<WH3627> to keep,<WH8104> and it is stolen<WH1589> out of the man<WH376>'s house;<WH1004> if the thief<WH1590> is found,<WH4672> he shall pay<WH7999> double.<WH8147>

If the thief<WH1590> isn't<WH3808> found,<WH4672> then the master<WH1167> of the house<WH1004> shall come near<WH7126> to God,<WH430> to find out if he hasn't<WH7971> put his hand<WH3027> to his neighbor<WH7453>'s goods.<WH4399>

For every matter<WH1697> of trespass,<WH6588> whether it be for ox,<WH7794> for donkey,<WH2543> for sheep,<WH7716> for clothing,<WH8008> or for any kind of lost thing,<WH9> about which one says,<WH559> <WH1697> 'This is mine,' the cause of both parties<WH8147> shall come<WH935> before God.<WH430> He whom God<WH430> condemns<WH7561> shall pay<WH7999> double<WH8147> to his neighbor.<WH7453>

"If a man<WH376> delivers<WH5414> to his neighbor<WH7453> a donkey,<WH2543> an ox,<WH7794> a sheep,<WH7716> or any animal<WH929> to keep,<WH8104> and it dies<WH4191> or is injured,<WH7665> or driven away,<WH7617> no man seeing it;<WH7200>

the oath<WH7621> of Yahweh<WH3068> shall be between them both,<WH8147> whether he hasn't<WH7971> put his hand<WH3027> to his neighbor<WH7453>'s goods;<WH4399> and its owner<WH1167> shall accept<WH3947> it,<WH7999> and he shall not make restitution.
But if it is stolen<WH1589> from him,<WH7999> he shall make restitution to its owner.<WH1167>
If it is torn in pieces,<WH2963> let him bring<WH935> it for evidence.<WH7999> He shall not make good that which was torn.<WH2966>

"If a man<WH376> borrows<WH7592> anything of his neighbor<WH7453>'s, and it is injured,<WH7665> or dies,<WH4191> its owner<WH1167> not being with it,<WH5973> he shall surely<WH7999> make restitution.<WH7999>
If its owner<WH1167> is with it,<WH7999> he shall not make it good. If it is a leased<WH7916> thing,<WH935> it came for its lease.<WH7939>
"If a man<WH376> entices<WH6601> a virgin<WH1330> who isn't<WH781> pledged to be married, and lies<WH7901> with her,<WH4117> he shall surely pay<WH4117> a dowry for her to be his wife.<WH802>
If her father<WH1> utterly<WH3985> refuses<WH3985> to give<WH5414> her to him,<WH8254> he shall pay money<WH3701> according to the dowry<WH4119> of virgins.<WH1330>
"You shall not allow a sorceress<WH3784> to live.<WH2421>
"Whoever has sex<WH7901> with an animal<WH929> shall surely<WH4191> be put to death.<WH4191>
"He who sacrifices<WH2076> to any god,<WH430> except<WH1115> to Yahweh<WH3068> only,<WH2763> shall be utterly destroyed.
"You shall not wrong<WH3238> an alien,<WH1616> neither shall you oppress<WH3905> him,<WH1616> for you were aliens in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
"You shall not take advantage<WH6031> of any widow<WH490> or fatherless child.<WH3490>
If<WH518> you take advantage<WH6031> of them at all,<WH6817> and they cry<WH6817> at all<WH6817> to me,<WH8085> I will surely hear<WH8085> their cry;<WH6818>
and my wrath<WH639> will grow hot,<WH2734> and I will kill<WH2026> you with the sword;<WH2719> and your wives<WH802> shall be widows,<WH490> and your children<WH1121> fatherless.<WH3490>
"If you lend<WH3867> money<WH3701> to any of my people<WH5971> with you who is poor,<WH6041> you shall not be to him as a creditor;<WH5383> neither shall you charge<WH7760> him interest.<WH5392>
If you<WH2254> take<WH2254> your neighbor<WH7453>'s garment<WH8008> as collateral,<WH2254> you shall restore<WH7725> it to him before<WH5704> the sun<WH8121> goes down,<WH935>

for that is his only covering,<WH3682> it is his garment<WH8071> for his skin.<WH5785> What would he sleep<WH7901> in?<WH6817> It will happen, when he cries to me,<WH8085> that I will hear, for I am gracious.<WH2587>
"You shall not blaspheme<WH7043> God,<WH430> nor curse<WH779> a ruler<WH5387> of your people.<WH5971>
"You shall not delay<WH309> to offer from your harvest<WH4395> and from the outflow<WH1831> of your presses.<WH5414> "You shall give the firstborn<WH1060> of your sons to me.<WH1121>

You shall do<WH6213> likewise<WH3651> with your cattle<WH7794> and with your sheep.<WH6629> Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> it shall be with its mother,<WH517> then on the eighth<WH8066> day<WH3117> you shall give it to me.<WH5414>
"You shall be holy<WH6944> men<WH582> to me,<WH398> therefore you shall not eat any flesh<WH1320> that is torn by animals<WH2966> in the field.<WH7704> You shall cast<WH7993> it to the dogs.<WH3611>
